channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: G7 Leaders, Expanding the Circle, Shift Focus to Migration and the South
item.description: Leaders from India, Brazil, the Middle East and Africa will join discussions on Friday, in a nod to the changing global balance of power.

item.title: Geneviève de Galard, French ‘Angel’ of Dien Bien Phu, Dies at 99
item.description: A nurse, she tended to the wounded as the French were under fateful attack by Viet Minh forces in 1954. Hailed in France and the U.S., she was given a ticker-tape parade down Broadway.

item.title: The FDA lost a whistleblower complaint about unsanitary conditions at an infant formula plant for a year, auditors revealed
item.description: It wasn’t found until a reporter requested it in June 2022.

item.title: Here’s Why Ukraine Should Seek Peace
item.description: A peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine will stop the killing and in the long run make Ukraine better able to defend itself and democracy.

item.title: Snow or No Snow, Australia’s Winter Resorts Are Open
item.description: Business owners say it’s hard to keep pace with the country’s sporadic snow conditions and spontaneous skiers.

item.title: Donald Trump aims to entice CEOs with lucrative tax cuts while Biden wants to win them over by vowing to maintain stability
item.description: The influential Business Roundtable plans to spend $10 million on a campaign for business-friendly tax codes.

item.title: Why Even U.K. Chancellor Jeremy Hunt Fears He Could Lose This Election
item.description: As chancellor of the Exchequer, Jeremy Hunt also represents a district where his Conservative Party traditionally counts on rock-solid support. Not any more.

item.title: G7 Leaders, Expanding the Circle, Shift Focus to Migration and the South
item.description: Leaders from India, Brazil, the Middle East and Africa will join discussions on Friday, in a nod to the changing global balance of power.

item.title: A 58-year-old Canadian man stole trade secrets from Tesla and tried to sell them on YouTube, authorities say
item.description: His accomplice is still at large, according to the Department of Justice.

item.title: Julian Nagelsmann Is the Most Important Man in Germany This Month
item.description: Julian Nagelsmann was hired to win a European Championship on home soil. Can he restore a divided nation’s self-esteem at the same time?

item.title: Elon Musk’s $46 billion told-ya-so: love for ‘incredible’ shareholders, dunks on New York investors, and the promise of a 110x increase in value
item.description: A buoyant Musk thanked Tesla’s shareholders after they voted to reinstate his pay package, the largest in corporate history. “Hot damn, I love you guys.”

item.title: How Baptists and the G.O.P. Took Different Paths on I.V.F.
item.description: The vote at the Southern Baptist Convention raising alarms about in vitro fertilization began with two conservatives at a seminary in Kentucky.

item.title: Why Even U.K. Chancellor Jeremy Hunt Fears He Could Lose This Election
item.description: As chancellor of the Exchequer, Jeremy Hunt also represents a district where his Conservative Party traditionally counts on rock-solid support. Not any more.

item.title: CEOs make nearly 200 times more than other workers and their pay hikes keep outpacing employees. It’s an ‘outrage,’ a top advisor says
item.description: More than 95% of Democrats, and two thirds of Republicans, say reducing CEO pay is an important issue.
